akn:subsection.akn:heading: Access to data and information obtained by lessee or permittee from oil or gas exploration, etc., data obtained by Federal department or agency from geological and geophysical explorations

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Access to data and information obtained by lessee or permittee from oil or gas exploration, etc., data obtained by Federal department or agency from geological and geophysical explorations

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Processing, analyzing, and interpreting information; availability of summary of data to affected States and local government

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Processing, analyzing, and interpreting information; availability of summary of data to affected States and local government

(c) Confidentiality of information; regulations The Secretary shall prescribe regulations to (1) assure that the confidentiality of privileged or proprietary information received by the Secretary under this section will be maintained, and (2) set forth the time periods and conditions which shall be applicable to the release of such information. Such regulations shall include a provision that no such information will be transmitted to any affected State unless the lessee, or the permittee and all persons to whom such permittee has sold such information under promise of confidentiality, agree to such transmittal.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Transmittal of information to affected State; protection of competitive position

akn:content.akn:p: (d) Transmittal of information to affected State; protection of competitive position

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Agreement with State to waive defenses and hold United States harmless from failure to maintain confidentiality of information

akn:content.akn:p: (e) Agreement with State to waive defenses and hold United States harmless from failure to maintain confidentiality of information Prior to transmitting any privileged information to any State, or granting such State access to such information, the Secretary shall enter into a written agreement with the Governor of such State in which such State agrees, as a condition precedent to receiving or being granted access to such information, to waive the defenses set forth in subsection (f)(2) of this section, and to hold the United States harmless from any violations of the regulations prescribed pursuant to subsection (c) that the State or its employees may commit.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Civil action against United States or State for failure to maintain confidentiality of information; certain defenses unavailable

akn:content.akn:p: (f) Civil action against United States or State for failure to maintain confidentiality of information; certain defenses unavailable

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Preemption of State law by Federal law

akn:content.akn:p: (g) Preemption of State law by Federal law Any provision of State or local law which provides for public access to any privileged information received or obtained by any person pursuant to this subchapter is expressly preempted by the provisions of this section, to the extent that it applies to such information.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Failure by State to comply with regulations; withholding of information

akn:content.akn:p: (h) Failure by State to comply with regulations; withholding of information If the Secretary finds that any State cannot or does not comply with the regulations issued under subsection (c) of this section, he shall thereafter withhold transmittal and deny inspection of privileged information to such State until he finds that such State can and will comply with such regulations.
